articles.title: "Not Consulted By Opposition": Mayawati Backs Droupadi Murmu For President
articles.description: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati said on Saturday that she will back Droupadi Murmu in the presidential polls, making her the first key Opposition leader to extend support to BJP-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA) candidate.
articles.content:
The BSP, Mayawati said, was independent to take a decision on the presidential elections. (File photo)
Lucknow: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati said on Saturday that she will support National Dem… [+2102 chars]

articles.title: Independents got twice the no. of BJP’s votes in Haryana civic body polls
articles.description: Haryana BJP president Om Prakash Dhankar said that the civic elections prove that the party’s base has expanded in the state.
articles.content: The BJP might be jubilant by winning in 22 of the 46 municipalities, which went for polls on June 19, but the independent candidates have secured about double of BJPs vote percentage. BJPs alliance p… [+2811 chars]

articles.title: US Draws Criticism From Closest Allies Over Supreme Court's Abortion Ruling
articles.description: The US Supreme Court's historic end to nationwide abortion rights on Friday drew unusual criticism from some of America's closest allies and bucks a global trend to more liberal reproductive rights.
articles.content:
The Supreme Court said that the decision "will save millions of innocent, unborn lives."
Washington: The US Supreme Court's historic end to nationwide abortion rights on Friday drew unusual criticis… [+4117 chars]

articles.author: Nirupama Subramanian
articles.title: 26/11 planner Sajid Mir is in Pak custody, years after it claimed he died
articles.description: Nikkei Asia reported Friday that Pakistan had arrested Mir to get off the “grey list” of the Financial Action Task Force, the international anti-terror finance watchdog. Indian agencies have held Mir to be more dangerous than Lashkar chief Hafiz Saeed.
articles.content: Sajid Mir, a senior Lashkar-e-Toiba operative and the alleged mastermind of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, who was once presumed dead, is in the custody of authorities in Pakistan. Sources familiar with t… [+5181 chars]

articles.title: Karnataka shocker: 7 foetuses found floating in gutter
articles.description:
Belagavi, Jun 24 (IANS): In a shocking incident, seven foetuses were found floating in a gutter in Mudalgi town of Karnataka's Belagavi district on Friday.
According to the police, the foetuses were stuffed in five boxes and thrown into the flowing gutter.

articles.title: 'Karnataka to split into two, India to have 50 states after 2024', minister says | Mint
